channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield, an unusual Harley-Davidson motorbike, an antique flapper purse and a pair of solid gold coins keep Dan and his assistant Ellie busy doing high-end deals. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, staff broker a deal on a fur coat and ring, and a 100-year-old music player.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Sheffield pawnbroker Dan Hatfield and his team try to do a deal on a set of rare commemorative stamps signed by legendary astronaut Buzz Aldrin, an upcycled burger van and a huge diamond ring. In Kent, pawnbroking brothers Charlie and Patrick Devine check out an antique dentist chair, while a possible deal on an £18,000 beach hut is enough to get Charlie on a trip to the seaside.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with Paul and his American bride Alissa, who were looking for a property in Windsor, Berkshire, and revisit Malcolm and Jenny in Wiltshire who wanted a welcoming and cosy atmosphere for their prospective home.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to north-west England, where Richard and Helen Francis have been experiencing the city-centre lifestyle in Manchester. However, with a baby on the way, they are looking to move to the suburbs on a budget of £400,000. In Preston, Graham and Nina Walker hope to swap their tiny rented terraced house for their first marital home.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: The experts help a couple looking for a property in Essex, with Kirsty Duffy showcasing the countryside and David Bull keen to show them the benefits of living by the coast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Brighton Surf hotel, where Jeremy and Elena Mann hope their hands-off hosting style will win the approval of their guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housing officer Niru Ghai-Read hosts the first dinner party in Wolverhampton, and feels confident her Indian-themed menu and choice of entertainment will secure her the £1,000 prize. Stefano Scaringi stuns his fellow guests - hippie Kyle Ferguson, part-time model May Dudley and student Bally Singh - with intimate questions, and Niru tries to maintain control on a noisy and eventful night.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Restaurant manager Stefano Scaringi hosts the second night in Wolverhampton, but has more than food on his mind, and an unexpected dessert drama causes chaos in the kitchen. Later, Kyle goes from chilled-out hippie to raging bull.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bally Singh decides on a student theme when he hosts the third dinner party in Wolverhampton, and his guests are stunned when he serves up beans on toast for his starter. Meanwhile, May Dudley has to endure another night of Stefano Scaringi's corny one-liners.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: IT worker Kyle Ferguson hosts the penultimate party of the week in Wolverhampton. The laid-back, self-confessed hippie has always been keen to offer his opinion throughout the week but now faces the challenge of impressing his guests by serving up a menu of his own.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Model May Dudley hosts the final day of the culinary competition in Wolverhampton, and leaves the planning to her mother. The evening begins on a high, until serving the tiger-prawn starter proves stressful, and the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Baltimore, Maryland, where Denise Whiting has alienated customers by trademarking the word `hon', a term of endearment used by the local community. When she opened Cafe Hon in 1992 it was a roaring success, but as a result of Denise's unwavering business ambition, people started to boycott the restaurant, leaving her frustrated by falling sales.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Wilkinsburg in Pennsylvania, home to Ms Jean's Southern Cuisine, which was opened by retired special-education teacher Jean Gould. During the chef's attempt to save the business from disaster, he discovers her soul-food restaurant resembles a dentist's waiting room and finds a lot of tension between Jean and her employees, who claim she is a Jekyll-and-Hyde character.(n)

programme.title: Cabins in the Wild with Dick Strawbridge
programme.desc: Dick Strawbridge and Will Hardie take a look at a cabin inspired by the legend of King Arthur and a low-tech double-decker tepee. They also travel further afield in search of inspiration for their own projects, visiting a sea fort in the English Channel and a romantic retreat in Sussex.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of first-time buyers who are struggling to find homes. In Southampton, Jenny and Tom are keen to move out of their cramped rental property and into a house of their own, but they are facing fierce competition and a fast market. Meanwhile, in the New Forest, Georgie and Will are desperate to live together after seven years of being a couple. However, with Will working in Belgium during the week, the pair are finding suitable properties are snapped up before they have even had the chance to view them.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, featuring The Spy Who Loved Me, Andrew Neil with Jeremy Corbyn, the SNP's Manifesto, Paul Hollywood's Continental Road Trip, the Green Party and SNP's Party Election Broadcasts, Your Face or Mine, Great British Skinny Dip and the News.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three previous restaurants he tried to save, finding out whether they stayed on the road to recovery or turned back into nightmares. First he heads for West Babylon, New York, where he helped the inexperienced owners of restaurant Classic American deal with their escalating debts, before returning to Davide in Boston, an Italian restaurant run by two warring brothers. Finally, he visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island, run by hot-headed owner Abby.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: Another look at some of the globe's most bizarre climatic conditions and the science behind them, including a vast cave system with its own weather, a desert in Brazil where people swim in lagoons while surrounded by huge sand dunes, and a lake in Argentina with water than can look like concrete. Plus, glow-in-the-dark waves in the Californian city of San Diego, a Canadian family who filmed an upside-down rainbow, a 50-year puzzle of mysterious lights in the Michigan sky, and `spider lightning' in Texas.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan's Out Out Tour
programme.desc: A performance by the comedian from his sold-out nationwide tour. He tells the story of his upbringing in London's East End and his rise to fame, making observations about the British class system along the way.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou gets stopped in his tracks test driving a £30,000 Radical racing car, memorabilia expert Lawrence Pickett deals with an intriguing enquiry about a piece of pop art, while handbag expert Claudia Valentin is moved to tears by a client with an emotional story. James also values a tiara belonging to a martial arts fan, which could be worth £40,000.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: An elephant calf is born at Chester Zoo, but its young half-sister doesn't welcome the new arrival. Meanwhile, Bush dog dad Franco is under pressure as its family grows, and an onager - a rare type of wild horse - faces a major operation.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of pioneering veterinary practice Fitzpatrick Referrals in Surrey, where orthopaedic-neuro veterinary surgeon Noel Fitzpatrick and his team help some of the nation's hardest-to-cure pets using cutting-edge procedures. A man travels through the night to bring his much-loved doberman down from Cumbria to see Noel Fitzpatrick about a diseased spinal cord. Can the professor and his staff bring the canine back to health? Other cases this week are a cocker spaniel rushed in after being hit by a car and a rabbit that needs surgery for a broken ankle.(n)

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: George Clarke returns to Harrogate, North Yorkshire, to check on the progress of Carol and Majid Nadry, who after 25 years living in a bungalow, embarked on an ambitious midlife adventure - buying a water tower to turn into a five-storey home. After huge delays and eye-watering legal costs, the couple have finally built the two-storey extension that was the key to creating a family home with character. George sees how the industrial heritage of this unique building is beautifully complemented by a 21st-century glass and sheet-metal extension that finally realises the old water tower's hidden potential.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: Sheffield pawnbroker Dan and his team at London Road have to deal with a grand bone china dinner service, an 18 carat gold bracelet and a tiny Cartier bear with a huge price tag.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Dan considers an Olympic football signed by the Team GB women and a 200-year-old picture with a royal connection. A monster sound system attracts the team in Brighton.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer catch up with two sets of first-time buyers - Isobel Phillips and Chris Martin, who were desperate to find their dream family home in the Cotswolds before getting married, and Claire Winship, a student looking to spend her £1.7million budget on a riverside apartment on London's South Bank.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to Hampshire, where former naval officer Colin Nugent and wife Gillian are hoping to buy their first home after 23 years of marriage and 12 relocations with the military. Meanwhile, Army captain Ian Bellamy will be leaving the forces and is looking for a new house with girlfriend Diane Pittard.(n)

programme.title: Coast vs Country
programme.desc: Amanda and Clive want to leave Bromley for West Sussex with their dog Lulu, so Kerr Drummond and Sara Damergi help them spend their £1.25million budget wisely.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Number 16, in Greenwich, London, owned by actor and antiques dealer, Robert Gray. Alas, Jan and Les find the dusty decor off-putting.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Gym fanatic Sophia Pottinger hosts the first dinner party of the week in south-east London, and has confidence in her simple, classic menu with dancing to follow. Sitting at her table are rock singer Francesca Santamaria, man-about-town Amadin Ryan, straight-talker Maria Eltheriouri and competitive cook Fraser Devlin.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Foodie Fraser Devlin hosts the second party from south-east London, and hopes his expertly cooked meal will land him the £1,000 prize. As well as organising entertainment for the evening, the host unexpectedly finds himself part of it.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rock singer Francesca Santamaria serves a music-inspired menu at the third party in south-east London, including starter Prawn to Be Wild and dessert Sweet Child of Wine. Her guests like the names but some are put off by the idea of fancy dress, and the discovery of a portfolio of revealing pictures prompts a surprise disclosure.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth dinner party in south-east London sees host Amadin Ryan pulling out all the stops to impress his guests with a Victorian banquet. He seems to deliver the goods, but the extensive preparations keep him away from the table for most of the evening.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Maria Eltheriouri hosts the final night of the competition in south-east London, preparing a Greek-themed menu of meze, moussaka, and a marshmallow, chocolate and passion fruit mousse. In a bid to win, she ramps up the entertainment, with all the diners enjoying a dance, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Loudonville, Ohio, to rescue Landoll's Mohican Castle, a custom-built, multimillion-dollar hotel set in an 1100-acre woodland estate. Co-owner Marta is struggling, having been left with the entire burden of running such a large establishment alone. Can Gordon persuade her son Jimmy to finally take the reins and turn this business around before the family legacy is destroyed?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef visits beachside restaurant Barefoot Bob's in Hull, Massachusetts, owned by husband-and-wife team Marc and Lisa. Every year profits nosedive through the bleak winter months, and matters aren't improved when it becomes clear they have both lost their passion - not only for the business but also for each other. With the restaurant and marriage on the line, Gordon tries to help turn things around before it's too late.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James Constantinou gets stopped in his tracks test driving a £30,000 Radical racing car, memorabilia expert Lawrence Pickett deals with an intriguing enquiry about a piece of pop art, while handbag expert Claudia Valentin is moved to tears by a client with an emotional story. James also values a tiara belonging to a martial arts fan, which could be worth £40,000.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: An elephant calf is born at Chester Zoo, but its young half-sister doesn't welcome the new arrival. Meanwhile, Bush dog dad Franco is under pressure as its family grows, and an onager - a rare type of wild horse - faces a major operation.(n)

programme.title: Micky Flanagan's Out Out Tour
programme.desc: A performance by the comedian from his sold-out nationwide tour. He tells the story of his upbringing in London's East End and his rise to fame, making observations about the British class system along the way.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: New series. Return of the documentary that follows the work of Bedfordshire Police around the clock as they investigate a number of major crimes. In the first edition, a man emerges from a hotel lift covered in blood and holding a fire extinguisher, before approaching the reception desk and shouting that he has killed someone. Cameras follow every twist and turn as detectives try to work out what really happened at the hotel close to Luton Airport, which has suddenly become a chaotic and bloody crime scene.(n)

programme.title: One Killer Punch
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the consequences of deadly single hits, from a row over a parking space in a supermarket car park to an unanticipated fight outside a nightclub. By examining three different assaults, the film shows that a single punch can have a colossal effect, often in innocuous locations and circumstances. The programme hears from three accidental killers and observes the circumstances that led up to a fatal punch, how their lives have changed, how their guilt affects them and the complex emotional journey that follows.(n)

programme.desc: Part three of three. Jim falls for PTA member Ms McKenna, Bridget is emotionally torn about her feelings for Jeremy, and Kerry is outraged to discover provocative dancing has been banned from the school formal. Guest starring Tatum O'Neal (Rescue Me).(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Jim's wife leaves him and Kerry annoys Bridget by dyeing her hair blonde. Meanwhile, the family therapist convinces Cate that she should pursue her dream of becoming a singer.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Claire is invited to the senior prom, and Jay volunteers to be her chaperone. Michael tries to teach Junior a lesson about money management.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.desc: Sookie tries to set Lorelai up with a poultry supplier, Paris and Asher make plans to visit England during the summer and Liz returns to Stars Hollow to announce she is getting married in a week.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.sub-title: An Apple a Day Keeps Abby Away.
programme.desc: Abby leaves for Los Angeles, and asks Holly, Kelly and Jill to spy on arch rivals the Candy Apples. Meanwhile, Cathy recruits members for a new team.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The enforcement officers visit a former professional footballer who owes £4,500 in unpaid legal fees, and in London the officers chase up a £4,000 debt owed by a car dealer. Elsewhere, agents Gary Brown and Cona Jackson are involved in a serious altercation with a young man who owes almost £11,000, who threatens the officers with a knife when they start listing goods to seize to offset the debt.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Toadie attempts to put the pieces of his family back together, Ben is shocked to hear Elly's suspicions of Finn, and all hands are on deck to assist as Susan comes home.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Roo tells James she is pregnant, while Kat and Ash move into the pier apartment and Brody demands that his family trust him, but gets into deep water with his dealer Zannis.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: After weeks of battling the other mothers, Jill and Kendall withdraw their girls from Abby's studio, taking them to her arch-rivals the Candy Apples. programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay convinces Michael to spice up their relationship by attending samba lessons with her.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids

programme.title: Dance Moms

programme.title: Baby Ballroom
programme.desc: Warren Bullock heads to a rock pub to give the locals a lesson in line dancing, and some of the dancers take a trip to the ballet to meet classically trained ballerina Simone Sault.(n)

programme.title: Pompeii
programme.desc: A gladiator in the ancient Roman city falls in love with the daughter of a wealthy merchant, who is being forced into marriage with a corrupt senator. When the nearby volcano Vesuvius erupts, he fights to save her and escape the destruction of the city. Disaster movie, starring Kit Harington, Emily Browning, Carrie-Anne Moss and Kiefer Sutherland.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Documentary giving an insight into cash-strapped Britain from the perspectives of debtors, creditors and those who collect the payments, including High Court enforcement bailiffs and repossession teams. The series follows each case as it unfolds, recording the thoughts and feelings on both sides, the process of repossession and the impact it has on all involved.(n)

programme.title: Bargain-Loving Brits in the Sun
programme.desc: Cameras follow 51-year-old Graham, entertainments manager of the popular Villamar campsite in Benidorm, who longs to be with his girlfriend Jackie 2,000 miles away in Northern Ireland. There's also a profile of Scouse singer Eddie who is trying to crack Benidorm's entertainment scene, and Amanda from Essex who makes her living selling and renting Benidorm apartments.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.sub-title: On Benefits: Bargain Barbie and Desperate Dole Claimants.
programme.desc: Job-seekers whose benefits have been reduced by the Government, including Doncaster single mum Sammy who has had her income support cut by 20 per cent after missing a job centre appointment. Former security guard Brian from Gateshead had to leave his job due to poor health - only to have his benefits lowered when he was told he was not doing enough to find work. Bradford ex-con Anthony moved into a new flat - but could not afford a bed, cooker or washing machine - while in Stockton-on-Tees, mum-of-three Simone stripped off in protest when her sister's dole was cut.(n)

programme.title: 8 Simple Rules
programme.desc: Part one of two. Bridget and Kerry are sent to stay with their grandmother, but stop off en route - only to be confronted by the shocking sight of Cate talking to a stranger in a bar.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Part two of two. Junior finally graduates, prompting proud parents Michael and Jay to reward him with an all-expenses-paid trip to Japan - which they also see as a way of ruining his plans to move in with Vanessa.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael is shocked to learn Junior is going to be a father, and reluctantly gives him a job - only to sack him on his first day for turning up late and being generally unsatisfactory.(n)

programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.sub-title: Last Week Fights, This Week Tights.
programme.desc: Kirk is disappointed when Miss Patty chooses someone else to be maypole dance captain. Lorelai urges Mrs Kim to call Lane, and TJ discovers the drawbacks of wearing tights at his wedding ceremony.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: The pressure is on for the Candy Apples, and no one's spot is guaranteed. Dance dad Rick worries when Jalen is assigned his first contemporary solo, and Cathy battles with Anthony as she struggles to regain control of her studio.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: The officers chase a debt of almost £2,000 in unpaid parking fines, and later encounter the extraordinary case of a debt of £80,000 owed by a hotel owner to his ex-girlfriend. However, as they begin to search the property, they call upon police back-up as the agents fear the debtor may have access to firearms. Elsewhere, two officers head to a car garage in Manchester where the owner owes £2,000 after losing a court case over a faulty vehicle.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Paige and Jack are grateful for Lauren's help in their time of need, Xanthe searches for answers, while a degree of awkwardness lingers between Aaron and David.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Ash and Kat collect Luc from VJ, but Patrick seems uncomfortable with the baby around, while Buddy the dog swallows the drugs that Zannis had given to Brody to sell.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: A vacancy opens in the studio's coveted trio when Paige loses her spot to undergo foot surgery, and the demanding mothers battle to claim the place for their own daughters.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay volunteers to direct Kady's school play, but has to bow out at the last minute, so Michael takes her place and allows the children free rein to take whatever liberties they like with Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet.(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael and Janet set out to impose peace on their constantly squabbling children by staging an argument between themselves.(n)

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Paige and Jack are grateful for Lauren's help in their time of need, Xanthe searches for answers, while a degree of awkwardness lingers between Aaron and David.(n)

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Hunter and Olivia's attempts to cheer up VJ backfire, Roo tells James she is keeping the baby, while Kat admits to Marilyn she is having trouble with Luc living in her home.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.sub-title: Dance Moms Down Under - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The ALDC heads to Australia to perform at the ASTRA Awards, but Abby loses her passport and Maddie misses a rehearsal.(n)

programme.title: Countdown to Murder
programme.desc: Documentary charting in detail the events leading up to the killing of Stacey Mackie in January 2012. Stacey ended her friendship with Terrence Armer, who became abusive and threatening, culminating in his gaining entry to her flat, dousing her in white spirit and setting her alight. The programme features interviews with Stacey's mother and sister and a detective inspector from Cumbria police force, as well as expert analysis from a criminal psychologist.(n)

programme.title: Wentworth Prison
programme.desc: Franky asks Jianna's son to help prove her innocence, and Liz's decision to testify against Sonia has serious repercussions in court. Drama, starring Nicola da Silva.(n)

programme.title: One Punch Killers
programme.desc: Cameras follow Aaron Roach Bridgeman as he hears from the families of people who died after being struck just once by an assailant, and investigates the science behind the violence to find out exactly how a single punch can kill. He also tracks down the perpetrator of one of these attacks to get his side of the story, and brings him together with the mother of the man he killed to find out if she can ever truly forgive him for the death of her son.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Wendy tries to expose the artificial enhancement of the female form in images, and Kanye West tries to prove to the world his fiancee is not a hobbit.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: New series. The boys decide to create a company in an attempt to never have to work again - only to accidently copy an existing football team's name.(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: Three masked intruders terrorise a young couple in a secluded country house(n)

programme.title: The Soloist
programme.desc: LA journalist Steve Lopez begins writing a column about a mentally ill homeless man with a talent for playing the cello. Lopez tries to help improve his life, but finds his new friend's state of mind a stumbling block. Drama(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: When war veteran Colonel Terry Childers is hung out to dry by military chiefs, he turns to an old friend, army lawyer Colonel Hayes Hodges. Drama(n)

programme.title: The Incredible Hulk
programme.desc: Doses of radiation turn a mild-mannered scientist into an angry, uncontrollable monstrosity in this adaptation of the Marvel Comics series. Lou Ferrigno, who played the Hulk in the 1970s TV series, has a cameo as a security guard and provides the voice of the Hulk(n)

programme.title: Hamlet 2
programme.desc: Steve Coogan stars in the comedy Hamlet 2, which follows a drama teacher who tries to put together a production of "Hamlet 2" to rescue his high-school theater department. Catherine Keener co-stars in the Andrew Fleming-helmed production(n)

programme.title: Stuck on You
programme.desc: Bobby and Peter Farrelly co-directed this irreverent comedy about conjoined twins. Greg Kinnear and Matt Damon star as Walt and Bob, brothers who literally stick together through thick and thin. That bond is tested, however, when Walt becomes an actor in Hollywood(n)

programme.title: The Rocker
programme.desc: The Office star Rainn Wilson portrays a drummer named "Fish," who gets a second shot at fame 20 years after getting kicked out of his band on the very night they signed the record contract that made them stars. Fish has spent the past two decades languishing at soul-crushing day jobs while his old bandmates became legends, continuing to grace magazine covers and dominate the radio. He might just get another chance at musical success, however, when his teenage cousin invites him to drum for his high school garage band, and they end up catching the ear of record executives. Now, Fish is determined to live the hedonistic rock & roll lifestyle he missed out on 20 years ago, but his new bandmates don't appreciate his hard partying -- and neither do his middle-aged knees. This Fox Atomic comedy co-stars Christina Applegate. Shawn Levy (Night at the Museum) and Tom McNulty co-produced the feature, which was penned by Wallace Wolodarsky and Maya Forbes, and directed by Peter Cattaneo (Opal Dream)(n)

programme.title: Last Orders
programme.desc: Based on the novel by Graham Swift, this is the story of a group of friends come together to mourn the death of Jack Dodds, who last request was to have his ashes thrown off of Margate Pier(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Mark Steven Johnson's violent superhero fantasy-morality play stars Ben Affleck as Matt Murdock, a guilt-wracked blind vigilante with a penchant for red leather. During his childhood, an accident involving toxic waste blinded Murdock, but it also enhanced his other senses and gave him a kind of 'radar vision'. The incident was partially caused by his discovery that his father was involved with the Mob. Now, the adult Murdock, spurred partly by Catholic guilt over his role in his father's death, has dedicated this life to fighting crime and protecting the innocent. By day Murdock's a defence lawyer, but by night he dispenses summary justice to criminals who've escaped the courts. Things get complicated when he falls in love with Elektra Natchios (Jennifer Garner). Not only is she the daughter of a man with connections to New York crime bosses but, unknown to Murdock, she's also a vigilante who's equally keen on figure-hugging leather (black in her case). And when Daredevil is framed for the murder of her father, Elektra swears vengeance on the masked crime-fighter (not realising that he's her lover). Meanwhile, both of them are in mortal danger from the actual killer, a merciless Irish assassin called Bullseye (Colin Farrell)(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: Sci-fi horror about a half-human, half-alien female mutant who escapes from a government laboratory and attempts to prolong the life of her species by mating with a human. Pursued by scientists and police, she passes through a chrysalid stage and takes on the appearance of a beautiful young woman. But she can also metamorphose from her eye-catching form into a repulsive, death-dealing monster(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: To clear his criminal record a former LA cop must infiltrate the Miami street racing scene to set up a drug baron. Burning rubber all over the city with his ex-con friend, he attempts to deliver the crook to the FBI without crashing and being blown to pieces in one of the many explosions(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: The true story of one of America's most violent and infamous gangsters, Whitey Bulger. Johnny Depp stars as Bulger, who was the brother of a state senator and was eventually convinced to wear a wire for the FBI to bring down the Italian mafia in Boston after they invaded his territory. Scott Cooper directs, with Mark Mallouk penning the screenplay based on Dick Lehr and Gerald O'Neill's 2001 best-seller Black Mass: The True Story of An Unholy Alliance Between The FBI and The Irish Mob(n)

programme.title: Death Race
programme.desc: In a grim near future, weighed down by economic chaos and high unemployment, criminals on death row race armoured cars for the entertainment of the public. The death rate is high, but the winner can earn his freedom. One such con is persuaded to race in the masked guise of a popular champion, but he begins to worry that an anonymous driver is unlikely to win this gladiatorial game(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Based on the true story of how Charlie Wilson, an alcoholic womaniser and Texas congressman, persuaded the CIA to train and arm resistance fighters in Afghanistan to fend off the Soviet Union. With the help of rogue CIA agent, Gust Avrakotos, the two men supplied money, training and a team of military experts that turned the ill-equipped Afghan freedom-fighters into a force that brought the Red Army to a stalemate and set the stage for conflicts in the Middle East that still rage to this day(n)

programme.title: Pale Rider
programme.desc: Director Clint Eastwood draws on his experience to put together a western with winning components: the bad guys are corporate jerks out for a profit at the expense of Mother Nature, the good guys are poor but independent gold miners threatened by the corporation, the hero Preacher (Eastwood) is there to set things right, and he is beyond any of that romance stuff. Preacher's shady past is implied when he first comes into town and keeps his anonymity intact. He is sheltered by an unmarried duo, Hull and Sarah (Michael Moriarty and Carrie Snodgress), and soon pays them back by saving Hull from a few murderous thugs. Caught in the middle of the growing conflict, Preacher rallies the miners into a combative group and then goes on to final showdown in true "high noon" style(n)

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: Sequel to the sci-fi blockbuster. After becoming the first person on Mars, astronaut Patrick Ross is infected with spores of alien DNA, resulting in a dangerously inflamed libido and an outbreak of alien offspring. Elsewhere, the monster who wreaked havoc in the original film has been cloned and united with government assassins in order to track down Ross and eliminate the new species(n)

programme.title: Stir of Echoes: The Homecoming
programme.desc: Rob Lowe and Shawn Roberts star in this sequel following an Iraq War veteran who is plagued by terrifying visions after returning home(n)

programme.title: Ricochet
programme.desc: A cop receives lots of media attention when he nabs an infamous, sadistic killer at an amusement park. The murderer stews in jail for seven years, obsessively following the rising career of his arresting officer, who becomes a DA with a promising future, a husband, and a dad. This doesn't sit well with the vengeful convict, who after escaping from prison, puts into play a series of fiendish plots in an attempt to destroy the attorney's marriage and career..(n)

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: A woman on the lam with her young daughter takes drastic steps when her abusive husband tracks them down(n)

programme.title: The Bone Collector
programme.desc: A paralysed forensics expert teams up with a fresh-faced cop to hunt down a serial killer. Thriller(n)

programme.title: Just Cause
programme.desc: Mystery thriller in which a Harvard law professor reluctantly gets drawn into the case of a young black man on death row in Florida for the rape and murder of a girl. The lawyer uncovers disturbing facts about the conduct of the police in the case, but just when he seems to have enough evidence to ensure the condemned man's release, events take an unexpected twist(n)

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up
programme.desc: A mysterious man saves a pregnant woman from a gunman and helps to deliver her baby. However, when the relentless gang kill the mother and continue to pursue the newborn, he resolves to protect the child and find out why he is being targeted(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: In Washington, D.C., in the year 2054, murder has been eliminated. The future is seen and the guilty punished before the crime has ever been committed. From a nexus deep within the Justice Department's elite Precrime Unit, all the evidence to convict - from imagery alluding to the time, place and other details - is seen by Pre-Cogs, three psychic beings whose visions of murder have never been wrong. It is the nation's most advanced crime force, a perfect system. And no-one works harder for Precrime than its top man, Chief John Anderton. Destroyed by a tragic loss, Anderton has thrown all of his passion into a system that could potentially spare thousands of people from the tragedy he lived through. Six years later, the coming vote to take it national has only fuelled his conviction that Precrime works. Anderton has no reason to doubt it... until he becomes its #1 suspect(n)

programme.title: Jurassic World
programme.desc: Twenty-two years after Jurassic Park opened on Isla Nubar, a dinosaur-themed resort attracts thousands of visitors each year, just as John Hammond envisioned. However, following a bad sag in turnout a new effort is undertaken to revitalise Jurassic World, but once again mankind's attempts to interfere with nature bring ominous results(n)

programme.title: The Man From U.N.C.L.E.
programme.desc: In this spy thriller set in the early 1960s, CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kuryakin team up to stop an international criminal organisation that is trafficking nuclear weapons and technology. Adaptation of the TV series of the same name(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: The author is forced to go on the run after being framed for the murder of a woman employed by insurance broker Lloyd Kurtzman. With evidence of his innocence in short supply and startling revelations coming to light, Beckett begins questioning how well she knows him. Drama, starring Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a clothes shop owner during an apparent robbery. An open lock suggests someone who works there was responsible, and the trail eventually leads to the son of the dead man's business partner, whose shady dealings were at risk of being exposed. However, the suspect flees to Israel before police have a chance to question him.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a white police officer, and the trail ultimately leads to a former black rights activist. As the trial gets under way, racial tensions in the city are inflamed with the emergence of evidence linking the dead man to several white supremacist organisations. McCoy realises whichever verdict is returned, it is guaranteed to be greeted with public outrage.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Flack looks into the death of a paintballer who was seemingly murdered when his killer swapped harmless ammunition for real bullets. The prime suspect turns out to be a rival who was competing with the victim for a sponsorship deal, but finding him is no easy matter. Meanwhile, Stella tells Mac she thinks she is being stalked. Forensic drama, starring Gary Sinise, Eddie Cahill and Melina Kanakaredes.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Hetty confronts Alexa Comescu and tells her Callen is dead, but the crime boss knows she is lying. Meanwhile, the agents search for their leader in Romania hoping to confirm she is alive, but when they mount a rescue attempt one of the team is shot. Real-time episode of the crime drama, starring Linda Hunt, Chris O'Donnell and LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: The author investigates when a senior lawyer who specialised in divorces is killed with an icepick. Meanwhile, his ex-wife, Meredith, moves into the loft to take care of Alexis while she recovers from illness. American crime drama, starring Nathan Fillion, Molly Quinn and Darby Stanchfield.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: The Machine disgorges the social security number of upmarket hypnotherapist Hayden Price and Finch books an appointment to see him, soon realising that the man is not only unlicensed, but also a con artist and thief. Meanwhile, Carter is still pursuing her plan to expose HR and tries to protect Laskey when Simmons and Terney ask him to kill a money launderer. Crime drama, guest-starring Aaron Staton (Mad Men).(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.sub-title: Swept Away - A Very Special Episode.
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the suspicious death of a reality TV contestant. They discover the show's producers had been provoking bad feeling toward the dead man among his fellow participants, while a cameraman reveals that his last moments were captured on film. However, the incriminating tape cannot be found. Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green have difficulty pinning the death of a strangled woman on their prime suspect, drug dealer Francis `Taz' Partell. However, while questioning one of his former associates, they discover new evidence indicating he was responsible for another murder in the Bronx.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac and the team are called to a deaf family's home, where a woman has been shot and killed - a case that brings up memories of Lindsay's troubled past. Meanwhile, Stella and Danny investigate the murder of a promising figure-skater who has been found dead at the ice rink - and come to suspect she was not the intended target. Gary Sinise, Melina Kanakaredes and Anna Belknap star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Sam goes undercover as a bomb specialist when he investigates the death of a demolition expert, killed while driving the car of a notorious club owner. However, he faces a race against time to find explosives located across LA. Meanwhile, Callen learns more about his past and Hunter decides to reshuffle her team.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team investigates when a reporter is murdered as she prepares to break a story about a mysterious Libyan freedom fighter named El-Libi. The activist is wanted by the country's government after establishing `radio free Libya' in the aftermath of Gaddafi's closure of the internet. Meanwhile, more details of Callen's past begin to emerge.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Director Vance charges DiNozzo with a special assignment to go to France, locate Admiral Kendall's wayward daughter Amanda and bring her home. Arriving in Marseille, Tony immediately heads to the local NCIS office, only to find five dead agents. After eventually tracking down Amanda, the pair embark on a rollercoaster ride to the relative safety of the nearest NCIS office in Spain. Michael Weatherly stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: An assistant district attorney is found strangled in his car in an area notorious for prostitution. Benson is shocked to realise she briefly dated the victim and refuses to believe he would have paid for sex. As investigations get under way, DNA evidence reveals the dead man might have been gay. Drama, starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The rape and murder of a criminology student puts detectives Stabler and Benson on the trail of a killer with an expert knowledge of forensics. A discovery about the victim's mentor places him at the top of their list of suspects - but as further evidence is gathered, it begins to seem that someone might have tried to frame him for the crime.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Murphy question a television producer when he is accused of molesting his daughter. His estranged wife wants justice for her child, but her failure to cooperate leads the detectives to suspect the accusation was a spiteful ploy. Hard-hitting and emotional series chronicling the life and crimes of the New York Police Department, starring Mariska Hargitay and Donal Logue.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Wolfe disturbs a miniature coffin during inquiries at a murder scene, triggering a series of strange events that convinces him the entire investigation is cursed. The approach of Halloween reinforces his belief that mysterious forces are at work - and it is not long before everyone else begins to share the same view. With Jonathan Togo.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A daredevil driver is decapitated while performing a stunt at a street party, bringing the festivities to a premature end. Realising the incident was murder rather than an accident, the team focuses the investigation on a bystander whose expertise with remote-controlled cars makes him a likely suspect. David Caruso, Emily Procter and Adam Rodriguez star.(n)

programme.title: Chicago PD
programme.desc: A member of the team is taken hostage by a desperate father who demands they find his daughter, who he believes has been kidnapped. Crime drama, starring Jason Beghe.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Castle looks into a mysterious death of a fan at a sci-fi convention, apparently killed by a genuine space laser, of which only two working examples exist. Away from the investigation, the event sees Beckett's love of the cult series Nebula 9 revealed. Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Van Buren orders Briscoe and Green to reinvestigate unsolved cases, starting with the murder of a teenager 20 years previously. However, they discover much of the evidence gathered at the time has vanished, and the detective in charge of the case may have pursued an innocent man to protect the real culprit. An unexpected confession allows the case to end up in court again, but legal trickery makes a conviction an unlikely prospect.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A man with a history of violence is arrested for the murder of his son's school ice-hockey coach, but pleads mitigating circumstances. Helped by a glib defence lawyer, he claims that he committed the crime while suffering from a previously unknown mental condition he calls `sports rage'.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.sub-title: And Here's to You, Mrs Azrael.
programme.desc: A teenager who was recovering from a car accident becomes the apparent victim of a mercy killing, forcing Hawkes to make an emotional return to the hospital where he used to work - and reminding him why he changed his career path from surgery to criminal investigation. Forensic drama, starring Hill Harper.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The CEO of a software company linked to a cyber-attack against the Department of Defence is kidnapped, and Kensi and Deeks go undercover to protect the man's family after fears over their safety. Meanwhile, Callen continues to research his past.(n)

programme.title: Castle
programme.desc: Beckett and Castle witness the darker side of the music industry while investigating the case of an up-and-coming female DJ, whose corpse has been recovered from a skip. Nathan Fillion and Stana Katic star.(n)

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Finch receives 38 numbers simultaneously from the Machine, each belonging to a different, high-ranking official inside HR, and discovers they are connected to an unknown player who is inciting a war between the corrupt police group and the Russian Mob. Meanwhile, Carter's past with her ex-husband is revealed. Sci-fi drama, starring Michael Emerson and Taraji P Henson.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the death of Karen Hall, a staff member in the State Attorney General's Office, whose body has been found in the Hudson River - and her boss Frank Conroy quickly becomes a suspect. Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the case of a couple found dead in their apartment, following a trail of drugs and money to the wife of an army officer responsible for anti-narcotics operations in Colombia. Despite the woman's reluctance to co-operate with the police, McCoy convinces her she has no choice but to risk her life in a bid to catch the murderer. Charlotte d'Amboise guest stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Flack and Stella interrogate a congressman suspected of involvement in the murder of a drag queen. Danny and Mac look into the case of an extreme sports executive found dead in a gritter used to de-ice streets, and Lindsay heads for Montana to testify against a man who killed four of her friends. Drama, starring Anna Belknap and Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team uncovers an alliance between al-Qaeda and a Mexican drug cartel when it investigates a shoot-out at a pawn shop. As the agents explore the reasons behind the unusual coalition, a Mexican police chief with a vendetta against the Mendoza gang joins them.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Hetty enlists the help of a former colleague when an ex-Navy intelligence officer is murdered, but things go awry when her old friend threatens to kill her. The team races to save Hetty and expose her one-time workmate as having lied to the victim in order to make money from a seemingly charitable venture.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The team targets a photographer with a secret life whose fantasies may have crossed into reality. Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Detective Munch becomes personally involved in the prosecution of a terminally ill embryologist who is accused of assisting a depressed woman in committing suicide. Evidence points overwhelmingly to her guilt - but the jury finds it hard to decide her fate. Hard-hitting police drama, guest starring Marlee Matlin.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler investigate the murder of an elderly woman who they learn was dying of cancer but had been determined to live out her final days to the full - a philosophy that encompassed dating a variety of men. Discovering her most recent gentleman callers all have alibis, they turn their attention to the murder weapon and realise they are looking for a serial killer. Anthony Rapp and Jane Krakowski guest star.(n)

programme.title: M*A*S*H

programme.title: Conan the Barbarian
programme.desc: John Milius's jingoistic direction and pulpy screenplay fit perfectly into this film version of the Robert E. Howard fantasy story of the sword and sorcery hero, Conan the Barbarian. Complementing Mulius's heavy metal production is Arnold Schwarzenegger's leaden acting, which in any other context would be deadly, but here (as in The Terminator) corresponds nicely with the whole sonorous project. The story begins when a horde of rampaging warriors massacre the parents of young Conan and enslave the young child for years on The Wheel of Pain. The Wheel of Pain seems to have as its only purpose the building up of Conan's muscles, so it's no surprise that one day Conan grows up to become Arnold Schwarzenegger. As the sole survivor of the childhood massacre, Conan is released from slavery and taught the ancient arts of fighting. Transforming himself into a killing machine, Conan travels into the wilderness to seek vengeance on Thulsa Doom (James Earl Jones), the man responsible for killing his family. In the wilderness, Conan takes up with the thieves Valeria (Sandahl Bergman) and Subota (Gerry Lopez). The trio comes upon a weird snake cult, linked to Doom, and Conan wants to trek off to Doom's mountain retreat to kill him. But he is prevented from doing that by King Osrik (Max Von Sydow), who wants the trio of warriors to help rescue his daughter who has joined Doom in the hills(n)

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee
programme.desc: Hugely successful fish-out-of-water comedy. Fighting snakes and crocodiles is Aussie hunter Mike Dundee's hobby. When he meets New York journalist Sue Charlton, their two worlds could not be more different. They meet when Charlton visits Dundee's homeland - the Australian outback - to interview him and find out about his brushes with death at the hands of a vicious crocodile. Intrigued by the man, Charlton invites him to visit her in New York to return his hospitality and, taking up her offer, Dundee is transported to the Big Apple and is amazed at what he finds. Hilarity ensues as Dundee tries to get used to the hustle and bustle of life in an urban jungle as even simple tasks, such as crossing the road leave him confused and bewildered(n)

Justice, Bandit furthers his chances at a stiff jail term when he offers a ride to Carrie, who hopes to escape her unwanted wedding to Justice's boy(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Based on a series of books by Patrick O'Brian, MASTER AND COMMANDER plunges viewers deep into the story of a British Navy ship at sea during the Napoleonic war. Russell Crowe stars as Aubrey, the charismatic captain who wrestles with issues like honour, pride, duty, sacrifice and loyalty while using ingenious tactics to engage his prey--a much larger and better-equipped French Man o' War. Paul Bettany plays his friend, the ship's doctor(n)

programme.desc: Jacob and Will Grimm are a sibling pair of con artists specialising in taking advantage of peasant superstitions about witches and curses. programme.desc: Doomsday comes to LA in this gripping tale of terror, panic and paranoia. When dirty bombs are detonated over Southern California, a husband (Rory Cochrane) and his wife (Mary McCormack) become quarantined, he inside their house, she outside. As contaminated ash rains down from the sky, chaos reigns across the area as those left out in the open run the risk of being poisoned by the fatal toxins. The film is the directorial debut of production designer Chris Gorak, who also wrote the script(n)

programme.desc: A mother and her daughter retreat to what they believe is a secure sanctuary during a brutal home invasion. Newly divorced Meg Altman (Jodie Foster) and her young daughter Sarah (Kristen Stewart) move into a New York brownstone equipped with a panic room; a hidden chamber built as a sanctuary in the event of unwanted "visitors," unaware of how soon they will need it. When their home is the target of a seamless late-night break-in, Meg and Sarah take a stand from the sanctuary of the panic room, playing a deadly game of cat-and-mouse with three intruders: Burnham (Forest Whitaker), Raoul (Dwight Yoakam) and Junior (Jared Leto), during a brutal home invasion(n)

programme.desc: Dr Rangan Chatterjee visits Nicola, who has been diagnosed with 10 different conditions, including fibromyalgia, ME, sciatica and depression, and her pain and exhaustion has led her to become reliant on painkillers and struggling to get through the day. The doctor also spends time with Laverne, who is suffering from stress and severe exhaustion and is at risk of developing life-threatening type 2 diabetes. Rangan must find a way to completely overhaul her lifestyle, including her diet, sleeping habits and work-life balance. Last in the series.(n)

Hollywood heart-throb Zac Efron also takes up residency on the sofa to discuss the big-screen revival of 1990s cult TV series Baywatch. Plus, singer-songwriter Beth Ditto performs her current single Fire. Providing there's time - and there usually is - Graham will also subject more audience members to the dreaded red chair - so their stories had better stand up to scrutiny.(n)

Louise struggles to put Madison and Alexandra's warning about Travis to the back of her mind, Michelle awaits a call from Tim to discuss the divorce and Lauren opens up to Stacey.(n)

Meanwhile, with Jac and Jasmine at odds, Fran makes it her business to reunite them with unsettling consequences. And a new arrival on Darwin gets more than they bargained for, especially after accepting Jason's help.(n)

programme.title: Broken
programme.desc: As the repercussions of Christina's actions start to hit home, Father Michael makes a discovery and must act fast to help her justify what happened to the authorities and her sister, Mariella. Meanwhile, new parishioner Roz attends confession to share a huge secret, prompting the priest to share a dark confession of his own in an attempt to dissuade her from the desperate course of action she has planned. The two share a connection, but is it wise for Father Michael to confide his own secrets to someone struggling to deal with their own?.(n)

programme.title: Newsbeat Election Debate

programme.title: Yes Chef

And to pile on the pressure, three-star Michelin chef Pierre Koffmann judges their final dishes. Culinary challenge, hosted by Sheree Murphy.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Family Finders
programme.desc: A 78-year-old man tries to track down a cousin he has not seen for 70 years and a woman employs an agency to help her find her father, who left home before she was born.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Paudge re-evaluates his arrangement with drug dealer Beady Burke, an indecent exposure case takes a mesmerising twist, and Sean puts his dignity on the line.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore Britain's knack for gardening as they continue their culinary journey through time. The duo also look at the country's passion for growing vegetables at home, a skill that has inspired some amazing dishes.(n)

programme.title: Elephant Diaries
programme.desc: The lives of orphaned baby elephants and the dedicated keepers who care for them. In the first programme, Michaela Strachan catches up with Lualeni to see if her situation has improved since her mother died, while Jonathan Scott visits Tsavo, where elderly elephant Emily has a surprise for him.(n)

programme.title: Highlands: Scotland's Wild Heart
programme.desc: The course of the seasons, beginning with spring, which sees the hills on fire on fire as the annual muirburn takes place in the Cairngorms. As the flames rise, an osprey returns to a valley near Loch Ness, with its movement captured in super slow-motion at 800 frames per second. Red squirrels and roe deer prepare for the breeding season, while a cataclysmic downpour has major consequences for a family of dippers, whose youngsters are forced to fledge early before the nest is swept away. Narrated by Ewan McGregor.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts James Braxton and Helen Hall set off on a search for potentially lucrative items, beginning in Oswestry, Shropshire, then heading through Montgomery and Machynlleth in Powys, en route to an auction in Carmarthen. Narrated by Tim Wonnacott.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch Unsprung
programme.desc: New series. Chris Packham and Lindsey Chapman return with the companion show to the main programme, which features analysis, news, nature quizzes, debates and photos and videos sent in by viewers. They are joined by guests Sue Perkins and Kate Humble, who discuss the use of dogs in conservation, and there is a report from Craig Revel Horwood on the dawn chorus.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Transylvania to the Black Sea - Part One.
programme.desc: Armed with his trusty 1913 Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo ventures east through Romania, encountering a bloodsucking vampire in Transylvania and brown bears in the Carpathian forest, before visiting a fairytale castle with modern conveniences in Sinaia.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing Wales prepare starters, with returning chef Phil Carmichael taking on newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie. The three chefs all create complex dishes, with both Paul and Phil championing the tomato, while Nick hopes his rabbit and carrot dish will give him the edge over the other two.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: In their second week at their base in the National Trust's Sherborne Park estate in Gloucestershire, Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke catch up on all the wildlife action that has taken place over the weekend. Plus, a report by Martin Hughes-Games from the northern tip of mainland UK about a colony of puffins, explaining what can be done do to help this iconic seabird.(n)

programme.title: Cosby: Fall of an American Icon
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of how US comedy giant and African-American role model Bill Cosby finally came to face a criminal trial for sexual assault a decade after the accusations were made, with proceedings set to start in Pennsylvania today. The film explores why it took so long for allegations that he was privately drugging and raping women with impunity to be taken seriously, with accusations from numerous women having fallen on deaf ears for years, and hears from journalists, co-stars and alleged victims.(n)

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Terry announces he is standing down as leader of the Danebury Metal Detecting Club, prompting the other members to vie for the position. Meanwhile, Andy and Lance fall out over gold, and Becky and Sophie are forced to become partners in a pub quiz. Comedy, starring Mackenzie Crook, Gerard Horan and Toby Jones.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy
programme.desc: Topical comedy going behind the scenes of the various political parties, following the various arguments and catastrophes that occur in reaction to the day's events. Written by Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Syria - Football on the Front Line

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Big Continental Road Trip
programme.desc: Paul spends six days exploring Germany in six different cars. After getting used to German driving on the streets of Berlin, he visits a Cold War checkpoint and a nudist colony, and pits cars made in the 1970s on either side of the Berlin Wall against each other. The trip ends at the Nurburgring racetrack, where he is joined by comedian Al Murray.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights

Last in the series.(n)

programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Milwaukee, a city on the shore of Lake Michigan, where he learns about the history of the iconic American Harley Davidson motorcycle. When Michael reaches the city of Illinois, he discovers how the modern day skyline of Chicago has replaced a largely wooden city which was destroyed by a great fire many years ago.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: A journey around some of the most dramatic coastlines in Europe, uncovering the stories behind how these landscapes have shaped history.(n)

programme.title: Red Rock
programme.desc: Nikki has to coax facts from a withdrawn victim and track down missing drug evidence, while Angela and Sharon try to aid an injured woman awaiting an ambulance on a rough estate.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore food-related customs associated with wedding ceremonies. The duo help prepare a Scottish breakfast fit for a bride and groom, and highlight traditions behind the star of the nuptial feast - the cake.(n)

programme.title: Elephant Diaries
programme.desc: As much as possible is done to help blind calf Ndololo. In Tsavo, Jonathan Scott follows attempts to pull Wendi out of her identity crisis and Michaela Strachan takes part in a game of football between keepers and orphaned elephants in Nairobi.(n)

programme.title: Highlands: Scotland's Wild Heart
programme.desc: For the birds and animals of the Highlands, the summer offers a chance to raise offspring before the days shorten and the storms of autumn arrive. Seabirds flock to the island of Handa off the Sutherland Coast, where 30,000 pairs of guillemots breed annually. Handa is also the location for a spectacular wild drama ending with the tiny chicks, known as jumplings, leaping for their lives from the 400-ft cliffs. Cameras also reveal life in the great rolling expanse of wetland known as the Flow Country, whose blanket peat bog stores more carbon than all of the forests in the entire UK.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts James Braxton and Helen Hall go head to head on the second day of their bargain-hunting trip, which begins in Newport and passes through Cardiff before ending at an auction in Wotton-under-Edge in Gloucestershire.(n)

programme.desc: Steered by his Bradshaw's 1913 Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo continues his journey through Romania. He taps into the nation's musical soul in Bucharest and loads cargo from a 100-foot crane in Constanta.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Pressure in the kitchen is high as the chefs prepare their fish courses. Paul Croasdale is trying to recreate the elegance of Wimbledon with luxury ingredients such as king crab and scallops. Meanwhile, Phil Carmichael and Nick Brodie are both preparing meals using mackerel which hope they can elevate for the exacting standards of the All England Club.(n)

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham, Michaela Strachan and Gillian Burke are live in the Gloucestershire countryside with the latest from cameras spread around the Sherborne Estate. From the blue tits and badgers to the owls and otters, the wildlife dramas continue to surprise.(n)

programme.title: The Chillenden Murders
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team looking into the killings of Lin Russell and her daughter Megan assess Michael Stone's second trial, and an alleged confession he made while in prison. They then investigate how the crime scene evidence could be forensically re-examined, and reveal another prime suspect for the killings.(n)

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Gyles Brandreth, Victoria Coren Mitchell and Jimmy Carr join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig to contemplate the theme of `not nearly'. As usual, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window in this quiz, in which the questions are so difficult points are awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting.(n)

programme.title: Election Spy
programme.desc: Topical comedy going behind the scenes of the various political parties, following the various arguments and catastrophes that occur in reaction to the day's events. Written by Guy Jenkin and Andy Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Cricket: ICC Champions Trophy Highlights
programme.desc: England v New Zealand. Action from the latest match of the tournament, which saw the Group A teams face each other at The SSE SWALEC in Cardiff.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels on London's first railway and admires the remarkable brick viaduct on which it was built, before taking a tour underneath its arches with a Victorian map showing the poverty of those who once lived there. The Docklands Light Railway takes him to Greenwich, home to the tea clipper Cutty Sark, before he ends this leg of his journey in West Silvertown.(n)

programme.title: The Fairytale Castles of King Ludwig II with Dan Cruickshank
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the aesthetic styles associated with Ludwig II of Bavaria, the king who was considered to be handsome and loved by his people. Dan Cruickshank investigates the mock-medievalism of Neuschwanstein castle and the complex design of Herrenchiemsee, to assess how they are key to learning more about the enigmatic ruler.(n)

programme.title: The Medici: Makers of Modern Art
programme.desc: Andrew Graham-Dixon examines how the Medici, a family of shadowy, corrupt businessmen driven by greed and ambition, transformed Florence through sculpture, painting and architecture and helped create a world where masterpieces fetch millions today.(n)

programme.title: Francesco's Italy Top to Toe
programme.desc: Francesco da Mosto visits Rome, the hilltop town of Tivoli and Naples, where he explores the city's subterranean tunnels and dodges its notoriously dangerous local motorists. He also stops off at the Galleria Borghese, and the water gardens at Villa d'Este, before meeting a family whose members live near the steaming sulphur jets of Solfatara.(n)

programme.title: Mothers, Murderers and Mistresses: Empresses of Ancient Rome
programme.desc: Professor Catharine Edwards explores the stories of women across centuries that saw the Roman Empire transformed, including the slave-turned-imperial consort Caenis, the empress Julia Domna, and Helena - mother of Emperor Constantine. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Egypt's Lost Cities
programme.desc: Dallas Campbell and Liz Bonnin join Dr Sarah Parcak on a journey to Egypt to find out whether cities, temples and pyramids are lying beneath the sands. The potential existence of the buildings was suggested by satellites as part of an alternative approach to archaeology.(n)

programme.title: The Fairytale Castles of King Ludwig II with Dan Cruickshank
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the aesthetic styles associated with Ludwig II of Bavaria, the king who was considered to be handsome and loved by his people. Dan Cruickshank investigates the mock-medievalism of Neuschwanstein castle and the complex design of Herrenchiemsee, to assess how they are key to learning more about the enigmatic ruler.(n)

programme.title: The Medici: Makers of Modern Art
programme.desc: Andrew Graham-Dixon examines how the Medici, a family of shadowy, corrupt businessmen driven by greed and ambition, transformed Florence through sculpture, painting and architecture and helped create a world where masterpieces fetch millions today.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo takes the high-speed line to Stratford in east London to explore the legacy of the Olympic Park and explores Spitalfields, an area of the city that has been home to many immigrants through the centuries. He ends this leg of his journey at Victoria underground station, where he finds out about the massive makeover currently under way.(n)

programme.title: The First Georgians: The German Kings Who Made Britain
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley investigates how George II's family fought the French, the Jacobites and one another at the same time. She examines his troubles with his son Frederick, Prince of Wales, and the way he led from the front on the battlefield, becoming the last British monarch to do so, and helped turn the country into a global superpower.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Spicing Up Britain - How Eating Out Went Exotic.
programme.desc: Documentary examining how post-war Britain went from being a place where eating out was more of a chore than a pleasure to a nation full of foodies who on average spend up to a third of their food budgets on restaurant meals. The programme investigates how Brits' palates have been slowly introduced to a range of culinary delights that once would have been considered `exotic' by successive generations of migrants opening eateries. Narrated by Rebecca Front.(n)

programme.title: The Secret History of My Family
programme.desc: The documentary charting social history by exploring different family trees continues with the story of Lavinia and Florence, two Victorian women from opposite ends of the social scale who were brought together by domestic violence. One was desperate to feed her six children in 1880s London, the other came from a lavish county home and ventured into the slum to help a fellow mother. The film tells the saga of a woman from the workhouse whose descendant ended up at Eton and a family from the landed gentry who threw off the burden of their past.(n)

programme.title: Storm Troupers: The Fight to Forecast the Weather
programme.desc: Alok Jha investigates how meteorology became one the most important scientific endeavours of the modern age by charting the progress of computer-based forecasting through the characters who pioneered it. He reveals how American mathematician Jule Charney found a way to simplify weather for the early computers of the 1940s, and looks at how John Mason gambled the future of the Met Office on unproven technology in the early 1960s. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Accidents Caught on Camera with HD Mirror Cam!

programme.title: Shark Rocket Complete with DuoClean Technology - For Floors & Carpets
programme.desc: World's first & only no loss of suction ultra-light upright vacuum, even more suction power than any Rocket before, advanced swivel steering, transforms to a portable vacuum, easily cleans drapes, under appliances, upholstery & car – still under $200(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 315. Billy Blanks Jr. pitches a dance-fitness program he runs with his wife. Other investment possibilities: a rock band, flavored peanut butter, and interchangeable bikini tops and bottoms. Also: a follow-up on a cat-drawing business(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 601. A couple from Fort Worth hope to interest the Sharks in their unique way to swaddle a baby. Other pitches include: a nail salon just for men; a better version of the athletic sock; and a free charging station for mobile phones. Also: Mark and Barbara take entrepreneurs to see their products on display at Target stores(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 719. Veteran and military spouse entrepreneurs try to drum up support. Included: a handbag company that uses upcycled materials, but charges $200 or higher for the product; "smart" gloves that can be used on the ski slopes and motorcycles; a personal organization business that promises to keep homes "majorly" decluttered; and two former Army Rangers who promote peace in dangerous places. Also: an update on an Air Force vet who makes canine meal bars invested in by Daymond John during Season 6(n)

programme.title: The Profit
programme.desc: Swim by Chuck Handy. A family-run swimwear company in Florida struggles to connect with consumers and keeps marketing outdated designs(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 411. Products include an energy-boosting nutritional supplement designed and tested by active-duty military personnel; an online boutique for bridal wear; and wine-tasting cruises. Also: a follow-up on a jewelry business from Season 2(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 510. A device that allows homeowners to figure out who's ringing their doorbell, even if they aren't home. Also: Sisters with a subscription gift service designed to provoke creativity among children; a North Carolina woman who has come up with a tasty slaw/salsa condiment; and an app that allows users to create and sell products(n)

Cameras follow every twist and turn as detectives try to work out what really happened at the hotel close to Luton Airport, which has suddenly become a chaotic and bloody crime scene.(n)

The spectacle was created by Derren and his long-time collaborators Andy Nyman and Andrew O'Connor and was filmed over two nights at the Palace Theatre in London's West End.(n)
